main.opener: You keeping out of the mess, or does it keep finding you?

factual.opener: Just say what you know. Everyone's hearing the same rumors. What's actually happening out there?
variants: It's all been Tribunal, blackouts, and protests lately.
Council locked everything down after a few broadcasts got out.
People gather sometimes, scrawl messages, but nothing changes.
They keep promising order. Feels like more silence instead.
Nobody knows who to trust. That’s about all there is.

Council factions almost tore each other apart when the evidence poured out.
Temporary Tribunal was chaos but honest for once. Made people believe in something real, even if it was short.
After that blackout, the streets started talking instead—messages on walls, analog lines buzzing.
Most of the newsroom pretended it was all normal, just the usual 'correction.'
I never bought the line that it was to keep order. It was fear—plain and simple.
Sometimes I think we’re all just waiting for the next glitch in their perfect system.
I saved the raw feeds from those Tribunal days—not official cuts. Some voices you just don’t erase.
You saw neighbors on the returnee lists, names you didn’t expect. People vanished for no reason except an algorithm’s mood swing.
Hardliners in the Council panicked behind the screens. Friends told me they saw two officials demoted live, unheard of before.
We all knew the Tribunal wouldn’t last. Soon as the public started listening, blackout dropped and analog leaks got throttled.
In the newsroom, old hands cried in the stairwell. Newcomers started trading contact codes in the margins.
I hid messages on shredded drafts, burned what I couldn’t scrub. Can’t trust a BCI score to keep you safe.
Songs, chalk, crowds—maybe distraction, maybe something more. The system’s fragile, and people know it now.
Rebel isn’t what I put on my files, but I don’t believe in aligning with a Council built on erasing stories.
Deep down, I hold out hope there’s another Tribunal someday—one that sticks. Until then, I just keep watching.
